alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Tuscola and east central Saginaw Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Caro to Reese to near Bridgeport. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fairgrove around 305 PM EDT. Caro and Vassar around 320 PM EDT. Mayville around 335 PM EDT. Kingston around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include East Dayton, Fosters, Deford, Arthur, Tuscola, Wilmot, Ellington, Gera, Gilford and Watrousville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
